p.s: The Sonnet 116, written by William Shakespeare is about his opinion about love.
The sonnet is addressed to or concerned a young man.
In the first quatrain he talks about love as aan uncontrollable feeling, which you can't change or choose (ll. 1-4).
The second quatrain shows that love is the one thing that is there if you need it and that gives you hope (ll. 5-7).
But which is also really mysterious and indescribably (l. 8).
The next quatrain underlines that love isn't the things you see from outside like rosy lips or cheeks, itsit's much more.
He describes love also as a never ending process wich will never stop (ll. 9-12).
The last couplet shows that he thinks all the things he said before are right, because if not he never wrote or a man never loved (ll. 13-14).
All in all ShakespearShakespeare describes in Sonnet 116 how he feels about love.
He talks about love very positive, what shows that for him love has a big impact in his life and is not just a small feeling.
